title: Microeconometrics Using R
text:
This book is under construction.
Microeconometrics Using R aims to be a comprehensive textbook on R programming for applied microeconometrics. The book will teache readers how to run a specific method they want in an accessible and practical manner. It simply provideSs you with one or more coding solutions to your implementation task for various econometric methods. The intended readers include professional empirical economists, graduate students in economics, and econ-based data scientists working in the industry, as well as researchers in other fields of social sciences. The book is open-source, and the author appreciates any suggestions, feedback, and contributions via GitHub.

title: Preface
text:
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.
